page.title: 11The Tourist Industry.
page.content: The Malvern Hills, maintained by the Malvern Hills Conservators, attract much interest among tourists. Chase End Hill is the most southerly and the smallest of the chain and is littered with bomb craters and old quarry workings. Raggedstone Hill is the next in the chain, on the western of its twin peaks is Red Earl's Dyke, which is cut out of solid rock. Eastnor Castle is a large house, built in 1812 in the style of a castle. The building houses a collection of armour and animal heads and is open to the public on Sundays and Bank Holidays. The grounds and castle are often used by the television industry. Eastnor Estate provides caravan facilities and also hosts other attractions. Bromesberrow Place is open twice a year to enable the public to view the Nurseries and the orchid collection.
